summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from April 8, 2021, coordinating logistics for FBI agents to assist with the evidence review for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The review is scheduled for April 13-15, 2021, at 500 Pearl Street courthouse, involving Maxwell, her defense team, and an AUSA. The emails detail security protocols, agent assignments, and room allocations.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case for whom an evidence review is being coordinated. She is to be produced by the Marshals and monitored by FBI agents during the review.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: The federal prosecutor who will be present for the evidence review at 500 Pearl Street and has reserved the proffer rooms.

connections.description: Prosecutor (AUSA) is part of the team presenting the case against the defendant (Maxwell) during the scheduled evidence review.

events.title: Start of Maxwell Evidence Review
events.description: First day of a scheduled multi-day review of evidence by Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team at 500 Pearl Street courthouse, monitored by FBI agents and an AUSA.

events.title: Multi-Day Evidence Review Session
events.description: A three-day evidence review session from April 13 to April 15, 2021, where Maxwell and her defense team will examine evidence transported by an evidence unit to the 500 Pearl Street courthouse.

keyFacts: The FBI was coordinating security and logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell's evidence review in her criminal case in April 2021.
The evidence review was scheduled for three consecutive days (April 13-15, 2021) at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse in New York.
FBI agents were required to have a handcuff key and were responsible for escorting and monitoring Maxwell, including trips to the bathroom.
The AUSA reserved three proffer rooms at 500 Pearl for the review: one for evidence, one for private defense conferences, and one as a break area.
The evidence unit was responsible for transporting all evidence to and from the location, relieving the assisting FBI agents of that duty.
